messages.content: this is Steven I want to conduct an interview about the cell service washing machine portal

Hello Steven, thank you for reaching out. I'm Askia, a question design expert, and I'll be conducting the interview with you today. To begin, could you please share with me some common pain points that users have experienced in the current ordering workflow on the self-service ordering portal for World of Washing Machines Corp.?

we are going to do a kickoff with all the executives and we have some of the pain points they know it's kind of an older system it does two billion dollars annually so it does a lot but they want to know if they need to redo the user interface when they're going to do an sap upgrade if they need to you know redo it from scratch

That sounds like a significant decision to make regarding the user interface during the SAP upgrade. To better understand the current pain points related to the user interface, could you elaborate on specific challenges users face with the existing system that make them consider a redesign during the SAP upgrade process?

we don't know the actual pain points will recommending an 8-week Discovery process which would start with on-site interviews with actual users we have done some surveys we kind of know some of the initial pain points from the feedback they get from the call center but we're proposing on-site interviews with 10 customers and a visit to the call center in Atlanta to speak with the agents who helped the customers on a regular basis

That sounds like a solid plan to gather insights directly from the users and the call center agents. To dig deeper into the pain points, could you share some of the initial pain points you've identified from the surveys and feedback received from the call center?

and it's difficult for them to replace that back orders can take too long and it can be 90 days and it can be difficult for them to find a similar replacement item of same price and same features so that that backlog is a problem

Thank you for sharing that. It seems like back orders and long lead times are significant pain points for users. Could you elaborate on how these back orders impact the users' experience with the current ordering process?

well customers get frustrated they come in and they order a particular front loading washer and they really fall in love with them and it's going to be 90 days and then and they can't they got to watch the clothes they can't wait 90 days so they got to find some alternative end with the tool can help them with Replacements and put that into the order it would save sales

It sounds like customers are frustrated when they have to wait 90 days for a specific front-loading washer. Could you explain more about how a tool for suggesting alternatives or replacements during such situations could help improve the ordering process and customer satisfaction?

well from the backorder list if you could click on a button it would say suggest and it would come up with equivalent similarly priced machines and you get add that to the order swap it that's what they're asking for

Thank you for sharing that insight. It sounds like having a feature to suggest equivalent machines of similar pricing when a product is on backorder would be valuable. Can you elaborate on how often you encounter situations where products are on backorder and how this feature would help streamline the ordering process for you?

I think we're getting hung up too much on the back of her I'm trying to do a kick off me I need your help with an agenda and some questions so what are some other goals that you have in this interview and what are some of your topics you want to cover

It seems like you might be looking for some guidance on setting up an agenda and questions for your kick-off meeting. In this interview, we are focusing on understanding the user experience of the self-service ordering portal developed by World of Washing Machines Corp. Our main goals include identifying pain points in the current ordering workflow, assessing how users search for and select products, evaluating satisfaction with order tracking, uncovering unmet needs or desired features in the portal, and evaluating ease of use for both first-time and repeat users. Is there a particular area you would like to start with or any specific questions you have in mind related to these goals?

hey I understand you didn't read it to me but that's okay I'm sure there's pain points there's there's things they like they like the the order status they can see what's coming today so they can organize Dock Workers to pick up the machines they're heavy so I have enough people at delivery time that's important

Thank you for sharing that insight on the importance of order status for coordinating deliveries efficiently. Could you elaborate on any specific pain points or challenges that users face in the current ordering workflow that the portal aims to address?

Can you elaborate on how often you encounter situations where products are on backorder and how this feature would help streamline the ordering process for you?

Moderator: It seems like you might be looking for some guidance on setting up an agenda and questions for your kick-off meeting. In this interview, we are focusing on understanding the user experience of the self-service ordering portal developed by World of Washing Machines Corp. Our main goals include identifying pain points in the current ordering workflow, assessing how users search for and select products, evaluating satisfaction with order tracking, uncovering unmet needs or desired features in the portal, and evaluating ease of use for both first-time and repeat users. Is there a particular area you would like to start with or any specific questions you have in mind related to these goals?

Participant: hey I understand you didn't read it to me but that's okay I'm sure there's pain points there's there's things they like they like the the order status they can see what's coming today so they can organize Dock Workers to pick up the machines they're heavy so I have enough people at delivery time that's important

Moderator: Thank you for sharing that insight on the importance of order status for coordinating deliveries efficiently. Could you elaborate on any specific pain points or challenges that users face in the current ordering workflow that the portal aims to address?

analysis.content:
1. Workshop Focus Themes

a. User Pain Points and Challenges
   - Description: Understanding the specific pain points and challenges users face in the current ordering workflow on the self-service ordering portal.
   - Significance: Identifying these pain points is crucial for driving the redesign decision during the SAP upgrade and improving user satisfaction.
   - Quote: "Could you elaborate on any specific pain points or challenges that users face in the current ordering workflow that the portal aims to address?"

b. Importance of Order Status
   - Description: Recognizing the significance of order status for coordinating deliveries efficiently.
   - Significance: Highlighting the operational importance of certain features in the current system that users value.
   - Quote: "They like the order status so they can organize Dock Workers to pick up the machines they're heavy so I have enough people at delivery time that's important."

2. Recommended Workshop Questions

Vision & Ambition Alignment:
- How do you envision the ideal user experience on the self-service ordering portal post-SAP upgrade?
- What ambitions do you have for enhancing user satisfaction and efficiency through the redesigned interface?

Current Challenges & Constraints:
- Can you elaborate on specific pain points users face with the current ordering workflow that necessitate a redesign?
- What constraints or limitations do you foresee in implementing changes to the user interface during the SAP upgrade?

Success Metrics & Impact:
- How will you measure the success of the redesigned interface in addressing user pain points and improving efficiency?
- What impact do you expect the new features, like suggested replacements for backorders, to have on user satisfaction and sales?

Team Norms & Collaboration Expectations:
- How do you envision collaboration between different teams to ensure a seamless transition to the upgraded interface?
- What norms or expectations do you have regarding communication and alignment among stakeholders throughout this discovery project?

Strategic Risks or Assumptions to Challenge:
- What assumptions underlie the decision to redesign the user interface during the SAP upgrade, and how might we challenge them?
- What risks do you foresee in implementing new features like suggested replacements for backorders, and how can we mitigate them?

3. Quotes & Signals to Reflect Back in the Workshop

- "They like the order status so they can organize Dock Workers to pick up the machines they're heavy so I have enough people at delivery time that's important." (Reflect during discussions on operational efficiencies and user needs)
- "Could you elaborate on any specific pain points or challenges that users face in the current ordering workflow that the portal aims to address?" (Use to prompt deeper exploration of user pain points)

4. Workshop Design Implications

- Suggested framing: Emphasize the importance of addressing user pain points and operational efficiencies in the redesigned interface.
- Stakeholder mindsets: Be mindful of the executives' focus on operational impact and user satisfaction, align discussions to these priorities.
- Team dynamics: Encourage cross-functional collaboration and communication to ensure a holistic approach to the redesign process.

title: Washing Machine World
topic: We want to discuss what we need to cover in a Washing Machine Self Service ordering tool discovery project
context: Background Context: World of Washing Machines Corp. Self-Service Ordering Portal (B2B) Overview World of Washing Machines Corp., a leading global manufacturer of home appliances, developed a self-service ordering portal aimed at its B2B customers—primarily retail appliance stores and distributors. This portal streamlines the process for retail partners to browse, order, and manage World of Washing Machines Corp. products directly, without the need for manual sales intervention. Purpose and Business Goals Increase Efficiency: Automate and simplify the ordering process for retail partners, reducing manual order entry and errors. Enhance Partner Experience: Provide a modern, user-friendly interface that empowers retail stores to manage their orders, track shipments, and access product information 24/7. Improve Order Accuracy: Minimize miscommunication and mistakes by allowing partners to input orders directly. Scalability: Enable World of Washing Machines Corp. to serve a growing network of retail partners without proportional increases in sales support staff. Key Features Product Catalog: Comprehensive, searchable catalog with detailed product specs, images, and availability. Order Placement: Intuitive workflows for creating, editing, and submitting orders. Order Tracking: Real-time updates on order status, shipment tracking, and delivery estimates. Account Management: Tools for managing billing, shipping addresses, and user permissions within retail organizations. Promotions & Pricing: Display of partner-specific pricing, volume discounts, and current promotions. Support & Resources: Access to documentation, FAQs, and direct support channels. User Personas Store Managers: Oversee inventory and place bulk orders for multiple locations. Sales Associates: Check product availability and pricing for customers. Procurement Specialists: Manage recurring orders and negotiate bulk deals. World of Washing Machines Corp. Account Managers: Monitor partner activity and provide support as needed. Deloitte’s Role User Research & UX Design: Conducted interviews and usability testing with retail partners to identify pain points and requirements. Portal Development: Designed and implemented the portal architecture, integrating with World of Washing Machines Corp.’s ERP and logistics systems. Change Management: Supported World of Washing Machines Corp. in onboarding retail partners and training them on the new portal. Continuous Improvement: Gathered feedback post-launch to iterate on features and enhance the user experience. Impact Reduced Order Processing Time: Orders placed and processed faster, with fewer errors. Higher Partner Satisfaction: Retailers report improved autonomy and satisfaction with the ordering process. Operational Savings: Decreased reliance on manual sales and support staff for order entry.
goals: Identify pain points in the current ordering workflow. Understand how users search for and select products. Assess satisfaction with order tracking and status updates. Uncover unmet needs or desired features in the portal. Evaluate ease of use for first-time and repeat users.
